Review.Titre: Surf Shark is a scam when you cancel…
Review.Contenu: Surf Shark is a scam when you cancel your subscription they continue to take funds from your account.  following cancelation process only turns off auto renewal which can be turned back on without you receiving confirmation.  Therefore unless you continually return to your account and check that it is off you will not know that the status has changed and you get charged.  The email they send cancelling is not proof as it only states auto renewal off and not cancellation.   So they lead you to believe you have cancelled when in fact this only proves the auto renewal is off.  They then turn it back on without your knowledge and claim you did it.  When you ask for proof they cannot produce it because of data protection how convenient

And the only way to cancel it is to TALK TO SUPPORT!!!! It's like it's 1999...If you go to PROFILE -> SUBSCRIPTION (where it's supposed to live), you can't see ANYTHING related to cancelling the auto-renewal. That is awful user experience, and a terrible customer service. 1/5 never returning again

AVOID, cannot really understand recent positive reviews, it's already a couple of years that is an absolute waste of money. Going back to the classics.P.S. The usual answer, contact this and contact that, as, before writing a comment, you didn't already try and gave up. Testing the FREE version of Proton VPN, no problems at all. So, probably, instead of going back to Nord VPN ot VPN Express, that I used in the past, I'll give a shot to their paid version. One final observation: I really don't understand how the guys that gave a good vote could remember the names of the support people. Each time is a different person that, by the way, doesn't read at all the previous conversation with the colleagues. Still one star cause 0 is not possible.

Review.Titre: Can no longer trust Surfshark with my money, so I can't trust them with my security.
Review.Contenu: Surfshark used to be a reliable company. Any biz that resorts to sneaking in an Auto Renew button set to default is predatory. It's a red flag. Only learned they were charging me is reconciling credit card account. It went thru via PayPal which I rarely use. I'm now seeing many customers having the same issue, so not an isolated incident.Surf conveniently only sends receipts to their in house surf account, not to your email, which they have.  I was refused a refund for 5 months of charges. I stated clearly I did not authorize auto renew & I never received emails with invoice or receipt.  Deleted my account immediately. For an outfit in the security business, if I can't trust them with my money, I can't trust them period.

Update: After multiple exchanges with customer service representatives and after posting on this forum, Surfshark agreed to issue a refund. Why a company like Surfshark with a good product (VPN) would require me to go on TrustPilot to get a refund is unclear to me.Surfshark had refused to refund me for canceling a dedicated IP within 30 days. They claimed I had already received another refund in the past 6 months. I explained to them the prior refund was to switch payment methods, as is evidenced by a new subscription the day after I canceled the old one. They basically ignored my explanation in order to keep the $90 fee.

Even if you realise that this has auto-renewed straight away and cancel, you can't get a refund for the second month because it's out of the 30 day period.This is all very misleading and unethical. Review.Titre: Proving your not a Robot on the web
Review.Contenu: Surf shark in general is a good product. This is so frustrating I switch Surfshark off, which defeats some of the benefits of the product.

Good at bravado, poor on delivery.  The business also seems to be focussed on non-Apple platforms.Two examples, my Apple mail will not send when VPN connected.  Their solution was not suited to Apple, therefore, I need to disconnect from VPN to send.  Second example related to Apple,  is that the company has a VPN service for Android/Google TVs but not for Apple TV.  The company made a song and dance about an App for Apple TV in August.  It has yet to deliver and has no timeline to so so.  Meanwhile many other VPN providers have done so.

Review.Titre: Blacklisted, useless servers.  Bait-and-switch for dedicated IP
Review.Contenu: Surfshark is quite competitive when it comes to features and price.  The actual user experience leaves much to be desired.  For servers in the Northeast, bad actors have caused the servers to be blacklisted by many sites.  In fact, Comcast has prohibited email traffic from passing through them.  Financial institutions, CVS, and many others have made logging in from a Surfshark IP address impossible.  This means that, unless you have a dedicated IP, for which they'll be happy to charge you, you'll be constantly switching servers and, most times, just turning off the VPN in order to use the internet freely.

Surfshark was effective in quickly changing my location to a new region (UK from Boston & LA) but drained my laptop resources too much. This may reflect my laptop more than the services Surfshark offers, but through speaking to customer support, Jaden was able to quickly and courteously initiate a refund and cancellation as it was within the initial 30 day period.

Review.Titre: Refund in the free trial period: a long and winding road!
Review.Contenu: The presence of the VPN causes a slowdown in the connection, resulting in grainy images in video streaming. I asked for a refund in the live chat, since I was in the trial period. The operator asked me to carry out a series of tests (from the speed test to changing the protocols). When I told him that the results were negative and I saw no improvement, he continued to avoid my request, first asking to continue the trial for the remaining days of the free trial, then asking to give the product a second chance, finally reminding me of the dangers present on the web to remain without VPN. I had to ask many times, even harshly in the end, to have a refund. The operator told me that the refund was issued, but I had to spend an hour on it

Annoying customer supportThe VPN is...okay. However, you can get cheaper and more feature packed services like PIA or mullvad. Be warned, getting a refund during the 30 day window through customer support is like talking to a brick wall that's been elected prime minister. It's been day 2 and I still haven't been able to get them to process a refund. Maybe one day I'll get a refund? Who knows?

I notice you didn’t correct the people claiming it is.

It has become so annoying that I’ve disconnected Surfshark altogether. BTW, Surfshark will not refund any unused portion of a subscription when it is cancelled. Bummer!

I signed-up for two years on the basis of the good reviews I read online, but now I am regretting it.1) From the start, I have been unable to send an email without first shutting down the Surfshark app.  I have spoken to the Surfshark help desk twice about it and each time received an unhelpful response (they would look into it and I would know when it was fixed because I wouldn't need to shutdown Surfshark any more - not that they would make an effort to notify me).  So I have put up with it over the past year, but it is irritating and I am unhappy with their muted engagement and limited effort and to-date there has been no solution.2) Recently the app has gone crazy and frequently tries to break the connection/reconnect, seemingly endlessly.  I have tried to shut it down, but that does not work.  A new version of the app was released today [27/11/2023] but it would not install until now - some hours later, after many attempts.  At first the new software would download but get stuck when trying to install, then I could not download it at all and an error message would say 'Try again later'.3) Generally, the reliability of the connection to the web varies considerably - quite often reasonable, but usually not very fast and it has patches of troublesome times and I quite often have to check on it and manually reconnect by trying different countries until something works.4) I don't particularly like the app design - as the main, vertical menu rolls over the top of the options, when open, so it hides the things I am eager to select.  It seems cumbersome to me.Overall, my experience has not been the best and the quality of support, although quick, has not resolved the issue I have been facing at the time, so I don't contact them any more; I have lost confidence in them.I am not going to renew my subscription when this one expires and I intend to look around for alternatives now and may quietly leave this contract early and just forget Surfshark.  I just don't want the hassle of explaining and justifying things that should be a given, when I do not feel that they have made much effort to assist me or keep me informed of any resolutions to reported issues.

surfshark works fine. not so good with kodi though. but it is made near impossible to unsubsribe or to stop your auto renewal of you subscription. this only can be done by contacting support. very easy to subscribe of course.

Review.Titre: They blocked my account without explanation
Review.Contenu: The price charged went up at every step - plus VAT, wrong dollar rate etc.After 1 week I got an email to say: “your account is blocked due to unusual activity” (two devices, very secure random alphanumeric password, hardly used beyond making sure it worked).  When challenged they offered to unlock if ‘just this once’ but never again without explanation of why it was blocked.  They made a strong and entirely libellous suggestion that I had leaked my own password to others.  Thankfully all this was inside the 30 day cancellation period and they have refunded me.

Review.Titre: It worked for me only for the first 3 months
Review.Contenu: It only worked for me for a couple of months. It is good if you can choose any random server location but that was not my case. I needed to use only 1 particular server country and for VoIP and it was excellent for about 3 months, then the connection went totally unstable. So it was working for the period of the time when I would have been able to request a refund. Now I regret paying for a 2 year subscription.I did contact their support service and they tried many ways to find a fix but were not successful.

Have been a user of Surfshark for over 2 years now and have to say they are pretty mediocre in the service they provide.Their VPN heavily throttles your browser performance from time to time especially with mobile devices making sites unusable or hardly responsive. Sometimes I would also get frequent service cutouts whilst using the VPN on main country servers such as US and UK.Lastly in order to cancel the service you have to contact their support rather than have the option to manually cancel it yourself in your account settings which is fairly sketchy in my opinion.Would not recommend!

Review.Titre: Great service - EXCEPT for the tracking
Review.Contenu: I signed up w/Surfshark in July while on hold w/another VPN chat support. (Issue took 24 hrs; their problem.) It actually works fine, is cheap, can include AV. But this last week I found out via TheMarkup - Julia Angwin's award-winning online tech watchdog website - that paid VPNs track you - even no-log ones like Surfshark. Surfshark told TheMarkup they track users for marketing purposes in this cutthroat VPN market.I wrote and asked them about their trackers, third-party trackers, use of advertising identifiers, Google Analytics, etc. Their reply: Check our privacy policy - which I should have done more carefully. Like everyone else, they have a long convoluted privacy policy; in fact, they have a multi-layered one that reveals they use third-party providers like Google Analytics and zendesk that also track you and build profiles of you, but it's up to you to read their privacy policies and/or simply "opt-out" of Google Analytics which places a Google identifier on your computer. This stuff matters a lot to me - enough so that I'm willing to forfeit my subscription. I am paying for privacy and there are other providers mentioned on TheMarkup that forego third-party providers and (I hope) provide as robust and comprehensive service as Surfshark but without the corporate accoutrements.

Leia should train the other customer service agents.

Review.Titre: I have used surfshark for almost a year…
Review.Contenu: I have used surfshark for almost a year and the service has gradually declined. I contacted customer support to request a refund for the remainder of my subscription but was told part refunds are not possible, which was disappointing. Review.Titre: Long connection time between web sites
Review.Contenu: Long connection time between web sites, frequent "I am not a robot", refused connection due to questionable server security risk, since I had none of these issues with Surfshark turned off or with previous VPN  I removed with time left on the subscription.

Review.Contenu: In the spirit of fairness I must state that my rating is based exclusively on my experience with Surfshark in China where it hardly ever works. In fact, I haven't even used  Surfshark in months. Thank God for another VPN provider (more expensive to be fair) which somehow manage to make their servers work continuously.

Review.Titre: Endless frustration due to problematic/slow connection
Review.Contenu: My MacBook worked fine until I installed Surfshark, but since then my internet connection has been problematic and slow. I'm often forced to restart my system, which logs me out of every website, and then I have to complete the annoying Captcha test at least twice, for every website log-in. This has wasted an awful lot of my time, and caused endless frustration.

Review.Titre: I signed up and downloaded the software…
Review.Contenu: I signed up and downloaded the software and was running Surfshark until one day it was gone off my computer with no trace, I don't know how it happened but what do I do now and am I still being charged for something I no longer have? why would it disappear?

Review.Titre: The connection is bad using Surfshark
Review.Contenu: The connection is bad using Surfshark, it dropped for nearly 60% after I have used to VPN.  For reference, I am in Hong Kong and I was connected to Taiwan server when I do the test.  Further to that, I often could not access to a certain websites like Netflix or some other websites for unknown reasons after I connected to VPN.  Could anyone fix this???

Review.Titre: Worked well to get me free Portuguese…
Review.Contenu: Worked well to get me free Portuguese TV on Chromecast with Google TV device(using RTPPlay). Review.Titre: I have been with Express VPN  for the…
Review.Contenu: I have been with Express VPN  for the last 5 years, and it has work well. I thought trying Surfshark as it was cheaper would be a good option. I'm extremely disappointed with the service. It's always losing a signal, and I'm having to look for a new server. I will be looking at other options as I'm not happy with the service provided!

Disappointed really, there are too many websites that won’t load until I turn off Surfshark, I should have cancelled within the trial period, my fault but I won’t be renewing.It seems that websites and apps from gambling to holidays to electrical retailers don’t be load with it on.

Well I thought a vpn would pretty much run in the background. Surfshark pops up 'on front' every time i switch my pc on so I have to click ok / close it (and wait for it to sort itself out)  before i can actualy use my computer. It also updates every couple of weeks - you have to manualy download and reinstall it (it doesnt do it automatically) - it's a pain. Then of course it doesnt remember my pasword - and I dont either - so I have to click forgot password, get an email and then go back to the app and re enter my email and password. It is about an hour or two's work every month - just for a VPN. As a vpn, it seems to work well. Its jus thaving to spend so much time on it thats a pain.

Review.Titre: Not serious enough and looks profit orientated only
Review.Contenu: I can't believe I am actually wasting my time writing this, but this thought me that I always should get a free trial on any subscription and not rush with a year or 2 buy.The good thing is that you can use the subscription on unlimited number of devices.Now the bad parts....1. I understood that a VPN can cut off a little bit of your internet speed, but I did not know that it can cut that much..in my case the internet speed was reduced by almost 90% no matter the country I connected to.2. How can you even dare to ask me (a lot of times) if I want to extend my VPN subscription when I just bought a 2 year period????3. There is no refund or cancel the subscription botton on any of the interfaces which tells a lot ....when I first wanted to refund I thought that I was scammed.....4.The live chat botton didn't not work for some time...apparently it was fixed I could ask for what I wanted.5. The email support it is a PAIN. Imaging sensing one email a day to the client and and not even doing what I asked for. Furthermore  they changed the operator from day to day...and I struggled to explain my intention to each one of them.I admit that it is also my fault that I realized after a little bit that I do not need this VPN, I take that blame.

When it works - it's fine.  Thing is, it will stop working several times a year causing you to have to remove it from your computer and reinstall it.  They tell you to dump all your cache and cookies - and that might help but not always.  All other VPN's I've used before this never had these issues.  So, a trade off for it being cheap is the total pain in the ass when it stops working.

Review.Titre: The VPN works alright but getting a refund is a nightmare
Review.Contenu: The VPN works alright, but does not play well with Android Carplay or opening certain websites on Chrome. The 30-day cancellation policy is a joke. If you ask for the refund they keep sending you e-mails asking to confirm the cancellation multiple times. At the same time they keep pushing you to not cancel by draggind the process along. So far no refund yet. Think carefully before signing up as you may not get your money back in case you have an issue.

I was helped my Myra.  It seemed there was a communication problem, we kept going round and round without her understanding the issue.  But eventually she had me send her a couple screen shots and recommended that I change some settings on my device, which I have, so we'll see if that ends up solving the problem!

Review.Titre: 22 days into my 24 month plan and BLOCKED
Review.Contenu: 22 days into my 24 month plan, i was blocked. They claimed I had breached the fair usage policy and i believe i was not the only one. Further search on the internet revealed that over the years many other usage had the same treatment and suspected is because of data breach and some users had their credentials used by others. Anyway really use SS at your own risk. The VPN service itself is alright, but how they sneakily scam some users out of their money through such unethical means is disgusting.EDIT/UPDATE:Have contacted Miles after receiving the reply here and he was able to share some information pertaining to the issue that I am having and appreciate his dedication to customer service and follow up. I was able to retrive back my account and looking back, I feel that Surfshark should rethink and rework their automated services that is causing several issues that many of the users are facing, in which in the end still require human intervention.

Single handedly the best costumer service i have ever received! Both Cody and Christopher were extremely helpful for hours while we were trying to figure things out bcus my hotspot wasn’t working. Unfortunaly we didn’t resolve it but that was due to my impatience nothing to do with them. I think i did something wrong in the setup witch messed everything up. Anyways kudos to those guys. But I give three stars because i wanted the vpn to connect to a apple tv and watch peacock, but that is impossible without  hotspotting from a windows device or messing with your router.

i have to say , Ike (the service agent) is the best of the best. ive ever seen any one who is so professional and patient in my life .he treat my problem like his own . keep encourage me and help me with all installation , even phone problems. god bless your company .but, the app is really bad. hard to configuration and download in china. even now , still hard to connecting with openvpn or surfshark.

Review.Titre: Very difficult to reach Customer Service.
Review.Contenu: Went to sign up and noticed they had my wrong zip code with higher sales tax.  I could find NO WAY TO CHANGE IT.  In addition, there appears to be no way to speak with a real person to correct the situation.Update: Was finally able to reach a person in Customer Service.  She suggested I try to sign up on my phone instead of my pad.  Was able to make that work and signed up.

Review.Titre: The app wouldn’t work, but the service was great!
Review.Contenu: The app and system itself did not work for me, nothing would connect and the VPN system did not work at all for me. I went into the live chat for some assistance and a friends customer supporter named Todd was a huge help. Although I was unable to get the app to work, he was super patient, respectful, and helpful throughout the process of trying to get it to work. In the end, he managed to get me my refund and cancel my subscription.

Review.Titre: A good VPN, only if you need one
Review.Contenu: Well, I'm having some issues regarding streaming some locations plus 1 app. But I checked another VPN (no 1 they say) and I've met exactly the same problems, which means no VPN is that good.Even though was unable to sort my issues, I still find their customer service friendly and responsive, and I dare to say that, at this moment, it's hard to beat Surfshark when it comes on what you receive for money. I will end by saying that I stopped using any VPN and I'm thinking to ask for my money back.
Surfshark provides updates only in a format that Win 11 Smart App Control automatically blocks. Support via email only.

Review.Titre: Streaming issue with CA - Toronto/Montreal; USA - NYC/Chicago
Review.Contenu: Likes: (1) both Dennis and Ivy were always eager to help (2) both were quick to respond and provide solutions.Dislikes (1) it felt like it was more like hit and trial solutions instead of concrete solution (2) issue not 100% fixed Ivy found me a temp. solution for now.

Review.Titre: Service was good for a few weeks then…
Review.Contenu: Service was good for a few weeks then started to degrade my response times on my ByPassed (Split tunnel) apps , like MS Edge.The support team were very helpful but we couldn't get resolved in the end. Worked ok on Fire Tablet and Samsung phone. So I had to remove it from my Windows 11 PC as there was no point having it on.I did receive a full refund as this was within 30 days (as promised) and I'd like to highlight that the support team are very helpful and knowledgeable. Would give 4 stars for Android app.

Review.Titre: Surfshark is a good VPN, but faces problems in  Indonesia
Review.Contenu: Surfshark is a good VPN, but not if you live in Indonesia. I could not download the App because that is not possible in Indonesia for whatever reason. (I cannot speak for other Asian countries). Instead of the App, one can download download the .APK file. The main problem I encountered was the loss of Internet download speed. I have at home 250Mbps (Biznet) and using any VPN location, I lost as well as for WiFi as Ethernet, 80 to 90% download speed which made streaming very slow to impossible. SurfShark did everything to help me (using other protocol settings) but the problem mostly persisted. I experienced a good service and I got my money back as promised.  I now have another VPN provider and don't face the same problem.

Review.Titre: This could be a 4 or 5 star app
Review.Contenu: This would be a 4 or 5 star app if they would stop bugging me. It is invasive. It can not be turned off. It insists on being called a 'security suite' and starting automatically while demanding system resources. While on it then goes the extra step of sending you popups with the only option to snooze for a month (and it will be back in a day or two, clicking month does nothing). Seriously, snooze for a month is my only option? No 'go away and never bother me with a stupid popup again' option?Well I also have the uninstall option. I also have the buy another VPN that I can turn on and off option. I think I am going with that other option. Enjoy trying to inject yourself into people's day.

Review.Contenu: It is a good VPN, but I was having buffering issues while streaming live shows from HBO in México.Magnus was very kind helping, and provided good suggestions on how to deal with muy issues, and when I finally decided I wanted a cancellation and refund, he was really comprehensive to proceed with It.

I already provided the answer and the course of action in my latest reply. If they just repeated that, it would've been fine. Therefore I am gifting 2 more stars (and now it will be 3).Treat me right, and in the future you have a potential to earn whole 5. Mistreat me, and 1 star will return.

The experience using this app is moderateso I decided to unsuscribe the servicethe customer support Ceel, provide full of support even my purpose is to cancel the serviceThanks Ceel

Review.Titre: Thoroughly test each app during first 30 days!
Review.Contenu: I would like to warn potential customers to THOROUGHLY test each app or connection you may use with this VPN in your first 30 days or you will be stuck. They DO NOT give anyone a refund for any reason after 30 days. I was lax in this testing because the reviews were so good and I didn't try it for myself. I have been in touch with their customer support team, which are extremely pleasant and polite, however, that is about the extent of it. At first, I couldn't get Netflix or Hulu to work with them. Then I could. BUT there are many apps it won't work with unless you are using your Windows computer. So, forget about watching Peacock, for instance. It won't work with that app, and a few others and with Paramount+, it works but there is so much buffering you cannot watch it. They told me "sorry". I bought their two year subscription. I'm out of luck.
The stupid Bot denies every qestion I ask. Asks only more not helpful questions. Make it possible to directly connect to an agent. Their help was very good!

Surfshark seems to work ok, I’ve only had it for a few months.I did have some issues with the protocols where I couldn’t browse on my phone without getting captcha from Google that was very annoying, apparently I need to manually switch to a less loaded server, also with mobile, surfshark is turned off most of the time since I have a secured Wi-Fi. The biggest issue I have with the service is regarding the fact that yes I did pay for two years bundle to get the economical pricing but then I found out my husband had already subscribed to extend service with our current antivirus software Norton and we already had VPN service. Only two weeks after the “trial period” I reached out to cancel for legitimate reasons and I must say they’re the only company I’ve dealt with that gives you such a hard time!! They’ve helped troubleshoot some of the technical issues but it was a hard NO on cancelation and refund on remainder of the term which to me is not good customer service. They force you to pay for their product regardless of what’s happening. For this reason I would say beware, you could be stuck with something you don’t use and they won’t do anything about it.

Review.Titre: I've given them plenty of opportunity…
Review.Contenu: UPDATED REVIEW AFTER RESPONSE I've given them plenty of opportunity to resolve this matter and didn't want to leave a bad review but I've now tried every means possible to connect in a restricted country and I am not receiving the service I've paid for. Despite other VPNs working absolutely fine. All I get is generic messages and scripted responses back like im talking to robots. Since I've come back to surfshark I've had problems with disconnecting, slow speeds and now I can't even connect at all. Incredibly dissapointed with the unprofessional attitudes shown to me. I mean why should I spend 2 days of my time trying to configure my setup like I'm an engineer?I've asked for my money back because I'm not receiving any service at all now for 3 days and won't for the rest of the month as I'm in this country still. How is that not grounds for a refund? Don't bother going with Surfshark. They want your money and do nothing to resolve issues and when you are completely unhappy with the service and are not actually receiving ANY service they would rather you give them bad review than just give you a refund that you deserve..EDIT After discussing the issues outlined above further with Miles, he has commited his time to help me to resolve the situation with the necessary parties involved. I understand that the situation in Egypt for Surfshark is a challenging one and they have assured me that they are doing what they can to provide a solution. Unfortunately at this time it was not possible and so they have provided me with a refund. I would like to take the time to praise Miles's patience, communication skills and dedication to resolving customer problems.

Review.Contenu: Surfshark is ok and good price, but on Windows I have to enable powershell to get 'windows background services' running for Surfshark. No other program seems to need powershell. Is this normal for VPNs ? Needing Powershell is not the kind of thing I want to see with a VPN.

Review.Titre: You pay for what you get...some hassles but cheap!
Review.Contenu: SurfShark is very reasonably priced, and, you pay for what you get.  I have had them for 3 months, and have had to call their tech each month.  First, it will not even open some websites, like Smith's and Albertson's.  If you don't stay online all day, it makes you log in each time you disconnect (a real drag). And, it doesn't automatically update to the latest version - so I had to call tech on that as there's no 'update' option in it.  In short - you pay for what you get.  I assume they work fine.....despite it taking up time to use them every single day....

About 3 odd hours later on chat trying everything they suggested still no luck. I was refunded my subscription fee. The guys trying to help were really good I can't complain about them . Just ashame they couldn't get it to work! 5 star for the assistance!!

Not sure if he could have found a workaround for email issues.  The requested refund was offered eventually but beware the Agents will try to convince you to use workarounds to avoid cancellations and refunds.  Be aware that payments and refunds are in US$ so (like me) your refund could be less than the amount paid if exchange rates vary.

And then I reconnect Surfshark and it works fine. It's the same on my phone, iPad and MacBook Pro. I know it's trying to protect me, but it allows sites that I am surprised that it does not block.

On the laptop I had their antivirus service running in background but not used (easy enough to disable thru services.msc). Mmmmm

Review.Titre: Frustrated with loss of online access
Review.Contenu: Since downloading surfshark I am currently struggling to access the internet even though I have a strong home signal. It is the laptop and ipad. My phone does not seem to be effected in the same way. I cannot get help because I need internet access for that. I have ensured no other antiviral programs are still active on my devices. Unsure what to do. It is frustrating. I think the rest is working but who knows!? I don't really know how to check.

The connections are fast, but I have a problem with some sites blocking the VPN at times, one being Mail on a Mac, and on these occasions I have to disconnect the VPN and let the Mail update or the website open, I then reconnect the VPN.I have not been using it for very long, so cannot give too many details about it.

Easy to install and easy to use. However, some of their servers are too busy and produce slow Internet connections. The server site that they automatically suggest “as fastest” is not necessarily the best. Sometimes you have to fish around. This can be frustrating.

Review.Titre: Love it in General, but not for what I need...
Review.Contenu: Surfshark has an excellent interface and very easy to use. Sleek and stylish in design. But, I purchased it so I could use unavailable apps in Canada. Many of those apps will still not download. This may be the only time I will purchase this VPN, unless they find a way to use IPs that will allow me to download apps like Peacock and Crackle.Thank you,

Review.Titre: The app is really easy to use but struggles on too many sites
Review.Contenu: The app is really easy to use and seems well designed but there are far too many websites that don’t seem to work with the Surfshark VPN turned on where previous VPNs have worked fine. That said the introductory two year deal is excellent value and hopefully in those next couple of years it’ll be more reliable with more sites.

Didn’t really get its purpose. So I canceled within the 30 day deadline buthaven’t received the refund yet.Thank you for your follow up reply. Just so you are aware, I had engaged in a live chat with one of your team members. He directed me to aninformation page to look at. Which I didn’t quite grasp. At that point I gave up.

Review.Titre: I was excited to be able to access…
Review.Contenu: I was excited to be able to access programmes from my country, using this app, but quickly disappointed - it failed to work with the BBC and it blocked my iPad's access to wifi , so my feelings about it all are lukewarm. I am sick of the restrictions we have in Switzerland - always being pushed to German catalogues. I appreciate the rapidity with which Surfshark enables me to go further, but the bugs are driving me crazy !

It’s ok. Noticed that can’t use some payment sites when vpn is turned on, this happens about 20% of the time. Also when wire guard is activated then doesn’t work most of the time, when I attempt to access IPTV apps. If I just use ikev2 then will work. Using in iOS.

Review.Titre: Price is good but speed is slow
Review.Contenu: Price is a bargain, a true value!But, lately (this couple of weeks), I found the average down load speed is way too slow for streaming. I mainly use Canada or US location, it’s should be not slow like 8-9 Mbps ( no matter in LA, Vancouver, NY or Latham) hope can improve in future

Review.Titre: Several times while browsing, I find I am disconnected and or signed out...
Review.Contenu: Several times while browsing, thinking I was connected, only to find out I am, not only not connected, but not even signed in. How long does your software wait before signing me out?Also, sometimes the page won't load (taking long time) unless I disconnect from Surfshark. Then I can open the page.Not sure how much longer it should take, but it is a long time.

Review.Titre: I can’t use this VPN in my iPhone 12…
Review.Contenu: I can’t use this VPN in my iPhone 12 Pro because it messes up my phone network and cut my calls middle of the call. This VPN is not suitable for iPhone in Finland at least. They said me at phone store you have deleted this app because it’s cut off your every phone call into middle of the call.

I really like the UI and the functionality, but the server speeds are much slower than I have been accustomed to, as a former customer of Express VPN. My download speeds using are typically less than 1/5 the speed when using Surfshark. The connections are reliable, but slow. I will most likely have to switch back to Express. It is more expensive, but you get what you pay for.

Review.Titre: Not able to access Indian streaming service
Review.Contenu: I am not able to access some streaming services ( Disney plus Hotstar, Voot, sony Liv etc ...) and have been contacting customer service for a long time and the problem has not been resolved.It's frustrating to see this happen. It does all the things except for which I bought the subscription for. Please fix this Surfshark.

Review.Titre: Not as good as the promotion says
Review.Contenu: Not as good as the promotion says. There are some problems:1. Connection speed is poor. 2. After disconnecting the VPN, the normal internet connection speed became very bad.3. No app support in Apply TV, the Apply TV connect functions taught on the website are all useless in Apply TV.

Review.Titre: I am very disappointed because it gets…
Review.Contenu: I am very disappointed because it gets in the way of many things.  It slows down many downloads and stops many others.  I have to disconnect in order to do many things and it seems that defeats the purpose!Furthermore your instructions to troubleshoot are beyond my comprehension.  You should be able to troubleshoot from there.

Review.Titre: The app is fast and well designed
Review.Contenu: The app is fast and well designed. Competitive pricing. However after a few weeks while things were fine speeds slowed down a lot and I keep getting issues with buffering. When I switch to an alternative VPN that's not the case. After a great first impression, disappointed.

Useful, but I experience interruptions of service (disconnects) that defeat the purpose of using it. I also can't log in to work remotely when enabled, further reducing its usefulness. I'm just glad I got it through a promotion and didn't pay the full price for it.

Review.Titre: Not as useful as I was hoping
Review.Contenu: Not as useful as I was hoping. Went with Surfshark instead of Nord and I’m beginning to regret that decision. The app is simple to use and does work well in some situations. I’ve been unable to use it on the go though. It gets blocked in many situations and support was unable to help and didn’t reply to my questions for troubleshooting. Since I’m unable to use it when I’m not at home that defeats the main reason I purchased the service. Can’t recommend it to anyone who needs it outside of home internet use unfortunately.

Review.Titre: Constant troubles asking access to confidential info in my Keychain
Review.Contenu: I started use it a couple of month ago. My private connection is not as fluid as expected using the VPN, sometimes need to exit to let all connect faster.Few days ago started ask me permission to access my confidential info in my Keychain constantly which is a pain...The support is fluid but suggested me to download a cleaner app to uninstall Surfshark and then install back. When you buy a VPN you expect not to waste time and work safely. A pitty I paid one year in advance...

Review.Titre: working fine - cant use it india server
Review.Contenu: working fine - i wish they do improvement for india server - its so slow compare to other VPN providers .I am waiting for there  confirmation saying that they improved india server .My home speed 100mbs And the main reason for vpn I could stream some Indian shows but it’s buffering all the time . I believe it’s server needs to speed it up . I already raised concern about it .They promised they do there best to speed up the server , hopefully they do .Other than it’s very simple to connect TV and other devices which is cool .

I had tried to watch something at my favorite streaming platform but the connection was not as fast as I expected and I received an error saying that I was using VPN. I tried the Support chat and got amazing support from Jane, the problem was solved until now but the speed still bothers me.

Review.Titre: PRO vs. CON: Frankly surprised I was asked my opinion.
Review.Contenu: PRO: Servers are plentiful, load on servers is hardly noticeable.CON: Seems to be in BETA mode:          Connections reset when you least expect it.          I have a FireStick. Although I have it set to autostart. To get it to work you have to manually start it.          I Whitelisted my banks and USPS. Still these sites pick-up on VPN and one bank stopped my ability to access them online. THEY ARE WHITELISTED! The only way to use VPN on these sites is to turn off VPN.To summarize, I'm waiting for my subscription to expire

Review.Titre: Hotel wifi would not connect with VPN on
Review.Contenu: Was recently in the UK. Used Surfshark with both US and UK VPN locations. At several different locations having my VPN turned on, limited or eliminated my ability to use the wifi - it didn't just slow down the wifi. The last time this happened was at my hotel near London Heathrow. Disappointing.

The performance (latency) of surfshark seems to lag behind others I have used such as ExpressVPN/NordVPN. Also it could use more IP addresses as I unfailingly see captchas when searching over google because of too much traffic from a single IP.Overall setup was easy and browser extensions are useful.

Review.Titre: I am not at all sure about Surfshark
Review.Contenu: I am not at all sure about Surfshark. Initially it was my own state to accidentally click on Albania instead of the United Kingdom, and every so often it reverts to Albania. I am also having terrible trouble with Google and BT mail as tabs disappear have to keep going through the rigmarole of signing in every time. Originally I bought it to keep my privacy on my Amazon fire stick, but I find that there is a further set of instructions to do it. I have no idea how much privacy I have. Also, I do not see why I have to give away my privacy to trusteer for someone else to bombard me with adverts.

Good overall. A few glitches setting up but with the customer support they were fixed. Speed is ok. Unfortunately it doesn't work with Netflix. Tested on desktop an Fire stick. Netflix will generate an error with Surfshank running. Very disappointed about this.

Review.Titre: I got surfshack to access The…
Review.Contenu: I got surfshack to access The BBCiplayer during the Winter OlympicsI choose Surfshack for their price and statement of being able to access bbciplayer.I found it tricky to access that although I did on occassionbut then it buffered a bit too much.

Review.Titre: Don't really work with emails server connection
Review.Contenu: Installed it as we were travelling in Malaysia. However, we could only connect to our Email server intermittently when using with Surfshark connected. Had to disconnect it for emails to go through on many occasions. Surfing the web seems ok though.

Review.Titre: Good VPN but sane old problems
Review.Contenu: Surfshark is a great product but it suffers from the same problems that the rest do. There are many websites/ services/ banking apps that will not work with VPNs. Someone needs to figure out how to get around this.

Review.Titre: Great security but some problems accessing content
Review.Contenu: I’m happy to have a secure vpn, but from time to time I’m unable to open links, such as following a link from Facebook or opening a linked news article. Also, sometimes larger photo files don’t send. When this happens I have to disconnect.

I think it works. But S shark needs to provide a better tutorial to understand where and how to use it. There are also a lot of kickbacks from technology companies were you have to turn off Surfshark Do you access things that you can access before.

Review.Titre: If you use Norton, buyer beware
Review.Contenu: I really like the product.  It was easy to install and worked great....until.  I use Norton 360 antivirus and as soon as I updated and ran a scan Surfshark was quarantined and I have never been able to get it to work again.  (I am very unhappy). After looking a several online tech bulletin boards (Tom's Hardware, CNET, etc), I have found this is a know issue and apparently there is nothing that can be done at this time, so my Surfshark 2 year subscription is worthless.  Too bad I didn't have this problem until after the 30-day refund period.  If you don't use Norton, this is a great product and I would highly recommend it, if you do use Norton, buyer beware.

Easy-to-use app and software. Cheap, Unlimited connections, but kind of slow servers. If shurfshark is on, the most of the most popular sites will have some mistakes, problems. You may not able to connect to several sites.

Review.Titre: The "idea" of a VPN is wonderful. Reality is way different.
Review.Contenu: The "idea" of a VPN is wonderful. Reality is way different. I used a competitors VPN for a couple of yrs and what I hated was almost every site knew I was using a VPN and wouldn't work unless I turned it off. Reviews of Surfshark seem to indicate that this would no longer be an issue. So I switched. Too many times I have to turn off Surfshark just to get anywhere on the Net. So what is the point? This doesn't happen everyday or on every site but it happens enough to be very frustrating. How is it these web sites know I'm trying to get to them via a VPN vice through my carrier directly?

Review.Titre: Does not work if there is already another VPN setup on the wi-fi itself.
Review.Contenu: It installed fine on my laptop, but would not configure on my Surface Pro 4.Main reason I added it was because I was moving to Mexico and concerned about banking and such, so added Surfshark.  Turns out the main wi-fi access already has a VPN installed at that level and to get my laptop to work at all I had to turn off Surfshark.Once in Mexico where it is legal to do online real money gambling I tried to register with Poker Stars, using a different wi-fi without a VPN and then Surfshark loaded, and set it to be from Mexico.  Somehow Poker Stars still thought I was in the US.  Note that Poker Stars support said I could not use a VPN at all on their site or they would cancel my account.

It is an Ok VPN, if price is what is most important then it is a good choice.  However it is slower than Nord and lacks some very useful features such as KillAp to terminate Aps when VPN disconnects and is also missing Ad blocking.

On about 80% of my using this VPN it is terribly slow, in fact quite often the website doesn’t completely load. This of course causes me to shut down the VPN to complete my task, which defeats the whole purpose of having a private network.

I tried to used it when abroad and the connection was slow and sometimes it did not recognize that i was using the vpn and i could not access the country's i wanted content.I had to reconnect and the problem was not fixed al the times

Review.Titre: It is better to add a pause button .
Review.Contenu: It is better to add a pause button .because the app is not stable.many popular web (such as nba or google search ) cant access when connected to it.i want to pause the connection to access those web

Review.Titre: Was not very pleased with the iPhone…
Review.Contenu: Was not very pleased with the iPhone app. always being disconnected or unable to connect. Currently I am stationed in Qatar. The app has been updated so I am trying again. Will see if this works any better.

Review.Titre: The service is fairly simple to use
Review.Contenu: The service is fairly simple to use and I appreciate that I can use it on unlimited devices. Also my speed does not seem to be slowed. My problem is the amount of Google searches that will not work and the number of times I have to go through the verification of not being a robot. So much so that I have turned it off on my iPhone. Also most of my streaming services do recognize that I am going through a VPN and give errors even when using a server in my home country. So I have had to tunnel most of my services out of the VPN. Finally I don’t see where to tunnel specific iPhone apps out the VPN. It’s all or nothing hence another reason I typically leave it off on my iPhone.

Review.Titre: It isn't as simple to use as it's made out...
Review.Contenu: It isn't as simple to use as it's made out in some adverts I've seen. Won't work on Netflix through my Amazon fire stick, won't work straight forward on my PS4, but it works fine on my phone and browser

Review.Titre: So far the picture quality is quite…
Review.Contenu: So far the picture quality is quite blurred most of the time. It may be that the connection to the French TV stations is the problem. I looked at Germany and the picture quality is much better. I'll keep on trying.
Lots of servers... User friendly app on smart phone and amazon fire stick. Not expensive. I am using this for 3months now. Overall Very good but speed needs to be steady and fast....

I would give them 4 stars for now. Although the VPN is quite good with their budget, online gaming is quite a hassle. But overall it's really good. Shoutout to Hadwin for giving me an excellent service. Such a pleasant conversationalist and a smart lad. 10/10 would recommend this man. Truly hope to talk to him again tho.
Good vpn, except if you want to seed torrents because they do not support port forwarding, also the auto connect breaks sometimes

The Netflix App keept saying that my iOS device was not only, when I enabled the VPN.3 minutes with Magnus from the Support Team, I Netflix as on the knees and showed me the Netflix Library as requested.

Review.Titre: The person who dealt with my call was…
Review.Contenu: The person who dealt with my call was very helpful.  i would have said five stars but the long  pause between replies was so irritating. But Hadden was very professional, steady but sure and   got there in the end and made me a very kind offer and restored my faith in Surfshark.

Review.Titre: Very friendly customer service but not…
Review.Contenu: Very friendly customer service but not recommended for Iranian users for connecting on different networks like other vpn services, perfect unlimited devices.
Despite the service not being for me, the customer service was excellent. My concerns and issues were promptly dealt with by Abbie and resolved without delay.

I cannot review the product fully as I was unable to get it to work on my computer (worked very well on my phone though). GUI/UX is good on phone and computer though.I'm reviewing mostly for the customer service: Tommy and Ivy (I worked mainly with Tommy) were very pleasant and it is quite possible they would have been able to solve the issue, but unfortunately, whether it's the fault of my device or not, I did not want to invest in a product that would be so difficult to set up (I was working on the issue of not being able to connect to a VPN for about two hours). Ivy processed my refund and I never felt pressured by either agent. I had a very good customer service experience.

Review.Titre: Renewal Problems Overcome with Chat Help
Review.Contenu: I had a tough time trying to renew my subscription at a special rate with my usual credit card: the purchase kept getting declined. There's nothing wrong with my usual card: it has worked successfully for hundreds of purchases this year. So it's a mystery why it didn't work here. Lyla on the Surfshark Chat app was very helpful & persistent in suggesting various solutions to the problem. We finally managed to get the payment processed using a different browser on a different operating system with a different credit card.

Review.Titre: Surfshark did what it supposed to…
Review.Contenu: Surfshark did what it supposed to during my travels & connecting thru public networks. There's a sense of security that each time i'm connected to the net whether i'm using my laptop or ipad - I know i'm protected. The speed was also decent during my travels in Europe & Asia.Unfortunately with a new job working from home, i no longer need to VPN. Kudos to Isaac for facilitating my request to discontinue my service & proceed with a refund with little to no trepidation.

Real IP-Adress still visable. Really nice Support. Instructed ways to get the right settings set up. Trouble shooting was also great experience (Router, PC, App).Sadly we couldnt resolve the issue. Forwarded Ticket for me to tech team, with aprox. max. wait time of 3 days.Hope then issue will be gone. Win11. LAN-Connection.

Review.Titre: Benedict help me to find the fix:
Review.Contenu: Benedict help me to find the fix:Quick to connect on chat line. Eventually got the solution after many problems by me in attempting to provide the requested info. Would have been 5 star but I felt it was not helpful that the support team could not accept word docs or PDF files during the chat session so I had to use emails which was slower but worked in the end and the solution was to reinstall my app. It was not a problem with Surfshark.

Review.Titre: The chat person was very informative…
Review.Contenu: The chat person was very informative and supportive. Although I decided to cancel my service with Surfshark, your customer service was a mark in your favor.Reply: My issue was with your Android app. If the server you are on becomes congested, it should automatically switch to another server. Instead, I received connection errors, Google captchas, and unauthorized webpages. The app forces the user to manually change servers when that happens. I'd prefer seamless service. Thank you for your response.

I was trying to connect via official app and manual configs from website - nothing of it worked.I was trying to get some help in chat - but i was blocked but automatic bot responses with another not working manual configsAnd only when I typed "refund" they connected me with real human and cool guy named Magnus sent me another pack of configs which were working.In the end: ive managed to get connected, didnt ask for refund and its all seems to be working (but not without hardships on the way)

Review.Titre: Work well on desptop, but not on cell phone
Review.Contenu: 1.	The app for Windows 10 doesn’t work well in mainland China, it discounts all the time. I contacted CS team, they replied fast and provided an alternative option to install the app manually. It works!2.	The App is not available on Apple Store while in China. The only way to use it is to set it up manually. However, it still doesn’t work.I purchased other VPN that claims still work well in China in 2023. However, it doesn’t. By comparing with that, I would give Surfshark a 4-star. Hopefully they can fix the issue for cell phone.

The program it self is a little complicated for my taste and i had to do a few extra steps to make it do what i wanted when i was about to lose my marbles i contacted support and Alicia was really kind to help me out,now it works like i wanted to They were easy to talk to and very willing to help

Surfshark is most secure & affordable vpn services with high end encryption and no logs policy. Unlimited device connection in single account is best features which attracts customer towards Surfshark, otherwise no one will be interested because servers are little slower than NordVPN & ExpressVPN.

I got a subscription for 27 months for like 47 dollars a great price I like the interface and it's fast no lag when surfing, customer service is great I took off one star because when I start up the program I get a Surfshark not responding message and it takes about 30 seconds before the message goes away then it connects I contacted support they told me to download Revo uninstaller remove the program then reinstall which I did but the problem still exits but it's a solid VPN and happy with it and customer support is great

Review.Titre: helpful customer service found a work around for an odd issue
Review.Contenu: I was having issues with surfshark connecting to F1 TV, and while we were unable to diagnose the root cause (likely all of their IPs being blocked by the service in a given country), we found a workaround using another country. Aina and Violet were both particularly knowledgeable and helpful.
The chatbot function is clunky and can get annoying.  However, the customer rep (Ceel) was great.  he managed to resolve my issues and was wholly supportive.

The Company's product "SurfShark" is very easy to use and its interface is very friendly. User can find an option to change setting/location very easily. The team members are cooperative, whenever User get a problem they are ready to help via live chat.

For the most part, I like it. There are some issues with streaming and clamping down of addresses for streaming services but I believe that happens with most of them. Some quality of life changes that make it more flexible would be most welcome.I wish they considered doing things like whitelist instead of blacklist. In my case, I prefer to add certain apps to be used on the VPN and not the other way around.Chat support was great and quick.

Review.Titre: Great service while need improvement on their software...
Review.Contenu: I have heard of Surfshark quite a lot. The advertised features and much lower price made me purchase the subscription. However, my first impression of it was not great. Compared to Express VPN, the client software is much slower to start. I contacted customer service as the software is not starting at all. Fortunately, Christopher understood my issue and provide a valid solution to it.Now I used OpenVPN to connect to their server and it works perfectly.In fact, they need to improve their client software and Surfshark will be much better.Overall, a good service.

The app is wonderful and could be used on multiple devices. The customer service is excellent, the support team is prepared with professionalism and patience. The part that I think could be improved is the connection quality from internet-restricted countries.

Charles, and then Kurt, went out of their way to try to get their VPN to work on a Chromebook that simply isn't compatible. I think this was a new problem for them and they looked into pretty much every possibility to get it done. We finally downloaded the extension which I think is the reasonable remaining solution. The only way this experience could have been better from the start is if this particular Chromebook problem was already in their knowledge base, but I'm not faulting them for that. Both were patient and good-humored about the whole thing. Good experience, I'll stay with this service.

Been with Surfshark for 24 months and does not have a bad thing to say about their service except a lack of servers in my country. I tend to move around from VPN to VPN and signed up with another before recent security improvements and the dedicate IP functionality was released. Had to cancel my renewal as I am not using both VPN. Their customer service was a joy to work with which I assume improved tremendously over the last few months - know this is something online reviews usually fault them on. I still think they have the best bang(product) for buck in the VPN sector - try them you'll be surprised.I gave them a 4 as there will always be room for improvement.
Todd was very helpful. Although he was definitely trying to make me stay with surfshark when it was clear my issue wasn't with surfshark. Not an issue, it's his job. But it did get a bit tedious.

Ive had Surfshark for couple years on a 24month membership worked for me exactly as it should, (Be careful with the auto renewal as it will still take money from your account even with a Expired card) If you need any Support join a live chat and they will sort you out in minutes. I had the pleasure of being assisted by Ike and he was straight forward and to the point.

Review.Titre: Cheap VPN, could be better tho
Review.Contenu: VPN worked but i didnt like the app too much and i had to contact customer support to disable auto renewal and to delete my account which I think should be accessible from my own account settings.On the other hand customer support was nice and quick, account gone in 5 minutes - Todd helped me with it.

Everything is working now. The speed is good. But I had to tinker with the settings. I had to install an alternative application - OpenVPN GUI, configure it manually.   Thanks to tech support and Elias in particular for his help and patience. 4 stars for the complexity of the configuration, although this is not the fault of Surfshark. :)

Kendra gave me time to ask all the questions I had regarding how surfshark one would work with my different devices. There was a little confusion with wording /description but I think I got all the relevant information. Thank you

Review.Titre: I was having trouble getting my payment…
Review.Contenu: I was having trouble getting my payment to go through, and the chat operator who helped me, Frederick, was just very patient and calm while nothing working, until he finally found a solution.

Ike gave it a good attempt to fix my problem but unfortunately due to my obligations and time restraint. I had to cancel my subscription. Nonetheless, SurfShark is lucky to have a diligent worker on their hands. Didn't give up on the task at hand and gave it his best. Ike is the MAN!
The customer service is fantastic; but you have to use a browser extension if you want to get around blackout walls. Other than that it has been a very user friendly experience!

Review.Titre: Looking for a Router Capable VPN.
Review.Contenu: Bought this VPN about a week ago.All worked fine on using their software, getting about192 meg from 200meg supplied.Installed on my router (Asus rt-AX56U very fast),but it chopped my speed down by 75% ( to 50 meg).Very good customer service, (speedy response) but not, even with their many excellent suggestionsable to solve this problem.Conclusion maybe it was their severs that were causing this bottleneck.Offered full refund and accepted (will wait to see how long for the money to hit my account).Not a bad experience just unfortunate it did not do what I required of it)Have just been advised of refund (Very prompt) so 1 extra star.

Review.Titre: Important Update If you have An old Laptopn
Review.Contenu: Since the new update, I have been having connection issues Once I have secured a safe VPN (country of choice) As I have outdated software for the latest current update, Each time I try to load Netflix for example or Travel websites, the connection would drop out/page wouldn't load. I contacted Cassian and his fellow colleagues and we came up with a solution that has the web extension as the only solution. Unfortunately, now the app on my laptop seems pointless, which is a shame, but I can still use it on my mobile device. Safe to say if your technology isn't up to date, its time to update/spend more money

Didnt really fix what I asked really tried to convince me to keep my subscription. (that kind of worked) but still always positive and straight to the point. Christopher understood every issue and question perfectly. with very positive messaging

Review.Titre: Very good service and helpful staff
Review.Contenu: Great service. Overall I would recommend using the app as the pricing is appropriate for what you get. If you need any help, their customer service is very responsive. Hope helped me with everything I needed and did it lightning-fast. Excellent service if You're looking for a reliable VPN with reasonable pricing.

I am actually quite happy with the functionality and speed of the service. My bugbear is with subscription renewal. When I looked at renewing the 24 month plan was best value and I proceeded to renew  three weeks before expiry of old subscription. With all other subscriptions it automatically renews from the date of expiry of the old one...not so with surfshark, which started the new subscription three weeks before the old one finished. On contacting live support I was told, Bad luck, that's how they do it at surfshark...Not good enough !P.S.I have been contacted by surfshark and the issue resolved as a misunderstanding and new subscription starting from end of old subscription ...

it took some work, but my contract was extended so that i was able to get close to the pricing being offered for new customers.  Generally speaking its annoying to get an automatic renewal invoice/debit only to see that new customers are getting literally a 50% cost break.  Then you have to deal with customer service for at least 30 mins
great vpn. The only problem I had was the low quality while using the HBO platform. Also, a very helpful customer service, I was greatly assisted by Todd.

The customer service is easy and quick, and the support specialist is nice and helpful.Edit: The missing star is because Surfshark haven’t TLS function, I would love to use Surfshark if it has the function.

Review.Titre: The company is definitely going In the right direction…
Review.Contenu: The company is definitely going In the right direction. The value is amazing but what really took them over the edge was their amazing support staff. Sophia was very kind and helpful. If they could work on increasing the speed of the VPN I would have gave a 5star review.

Review.Titre: Fiona was a great help to me working…
Review.Contenu: Fiona was a great help to me working thru the complexity of setting up my router.  She was very kind and helpful and shared a lot of her knowledge with me.  I learned from this experience.

I've used Surfshark for over two years on multiple Windows and Android devices and it has presented very few problems. It has fast speeds, reliable connections, a pretty decent user interface and regular software updates. It's also quite affordable. Plenty of servers and locations to choose from and more security is available for an extra fee (which you may see as a pro or con). The ability to be able to install and use Surfshark on unlimited devices is very handy and I also liked being able to log-in without needing a password (as long as I was already logged in on another device).The only real downside was that there is no option to cancel the auto-renewal in my account settings which is the only time I've had to contact customer support. I'm now using a different VPN simply because my plan was coming to an end and I saw a good deal elsewhere. I do recommend Surfshark as you can't go far wrong with it and who knows, I may end up going back to them sometime in the future.

Review.Titre: This is my special thanks to Elara from Surfshark customer support
Review.Contenu: I had a great experience with Surfshark customer support, Elara who helped me to solve my installation issue. I rarely write reviews, but I felt compelled to share how patient and persistent Elara was in troubleshooting the problem. It turned out that there was some issue with my .NET Framework on my Microsoft notebook, which prevented the Surfshark application from installing properly. Elara explained everything clearly and gave me a lot of useful information. She tried different methods and did not give me. She had spent at least two hours on helping me, and I really appreciate her dedication and professionalism. She even taught me how to approach Microsoft support and how to describe my issue with them. All of these are very helpful.Thank you, Elara, for your excellent service!
